result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose S Arredondo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jose S Arredondo in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for motion hearing.  Defense withdraws motion.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

to Extend Time for Filing, filed.

Defendant Jose S Arredondo in court with attorney Michael Jude.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
BRANCH 45 for BRANCH 24. Defense requests a motion hearing date.  Defense to file any motions by 8-03-2015; State's reply due by 8-31-2015. Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jose S Arredondo in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jose S Arredondo in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jose S Arredondo in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
